title: Applied Biostatistics with R  Biostatistiques appliqu√©es avec R
text: Fran√ßais / English

title: Syllabus
text:
Biostatistique appliqu√©e √† des probl√®mes r√©els. Conception exp√©rimentale et collecte de donn√©es. Cons√©quences de la violation des hypoth√®ses de diff√©rents tests. Analyse de Monte Carlo et Bootstrap. √âtudes de cas et exercices d‚Äôutilisation de progiciels d‚Äôanalyse statistique.
Le cours couvre les fondements des statistiques (distributions, ICs, p-values, th√©or√®me de la limite centrale, pens√©e bay√©sienne, ‚Ä¶) et les mod√®les lin√©aires (t-test, ANOVA, r√©gression, ANCOVA, mod√®le lin√©aire g√©n√©ral) en utilisant R.

title: Syllabus
text:
Travaux de laboratoire
Les rapports √©crits comptent pour 40% de la note finale. Il y a 8 rapports et ils comptent donc pour 5% chacun. Vous pouvez travailler individuellement ou en √©quipe jusqu‚Äô√† trois (cette derni√®re est encourag√©e). Si vous soumettez un travail d‚Äô√©quipe, tous les membres de l‚Äô√©quipe recevront la m√™me note, sauf circonstances exceptionnelles. Vous devez soumettre une seule copie PDF de vos travaux avec les noms et identifiants de tous les √©tudiants en haut de la page (soumettre une seule copie pour le groupe). Les travaux en retard seront p√©nalis√©s de 10 % par jour ou partie de jour. Les devoirs consisteront soit en une s√©rie de questions auxquelles il faudra r√©pondre, soit en une analyse statistique √† effectuer. Un bar√®me de notation sp√©cifique est fourni pour chaque rapport sur Brightspace

title: Syllabus
text:
Examens

Mi-session
Dur√©e de 1h30 apr√®s la semaine de rel√¢che durant la p√©riode de labo. En classe (voir l‚Äôhoraire pour la date), livre ouvert, les calculatrices sont autoris√©es. Aucun rattrapage ne sera propos√©.
L‚Äôexamen de mi-session sera disponible sur le site web du cours par la suite ; si vous ne le passez pas officiellement (par exemple, pour des raisons m√©dicales), je vous sugg√®re fortement de l‚Äôessayer sur votre temps libre. Nous nous ferons un plaisir de le noter pour vous donner un feedback (votre note ne sera pas prise en compte dans votre note finale). Ceux qui manquent l‚Äôexamen de mi-parcours et ne le font pas ont g√©n√©ralement de mauvais r√©sultats √† l‚Äôexamen final.


Examen final (Bio4558 uniquement)
Il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun examen √† livre ouvert, les notes de cours et les calculatrices √©tant autoris√©es. L‚Äôexamen durera 3h et posera des questions th√©oriques et pratiques, y compris quelques petits calculs. Il n‚Äôest pas n√©cessaire d‚Äôex√©cuter un code R.

title: Syllabus
text:
Rapport suppl√©mentaire (Bio5558 uniquement)
L‚Äô√©valuation finale prendra la forme d‚Äôun rapport √©crit de l‚Äôanalyse des donn√©es (unique pour chaque √©tudiant) de 15 pages √† soumettre avant la p√©riode d‚Äôexamen.

title: James Santangelo
text:
James est Professeur adjoint √† l‚ÄôUniversit√© d‚ÄôOttawa en biologie √©volutive et quantitative et il enseigne R (et l‚Äôapprend) depuis plus de 8 ans.
Les mat√©riaux sure ce site on √©t√© cr√©√©s par Julien Martin, professeur agr√©g√© en biology evolutive √† l‚ÄôUniversit√© d‚ÄôOttawa. Ils ont √©t√© cr√©√©s en utilisant Quarto, R, revealjs, mermaid.js et graphViz.

title: Bio4x58-5x58
text:
Schedule 

Lectures

Mondays, 1300-1420 in DMS-1110
Wednesdays, 1130-1250 in DMS-1110

Practicals

Wednesdays, 1430-1720 in MNT-141/142


There are no lectures or tutorials during reading week.
Mid-term will be during the lab following reading week.
Final exam will be during exam week.

title: Practicals
text:
General info
There are 8 practicals during the term. Practicals will be done in teams of 1-3 for the entire term. Please bring your laptop and make sure to have a recent version of R (4.0.0 or higher) as well as a R IDE such as RStudio or VSCode. Finally it is highly recommended to also have quarto software to produce reproducible reports.
You will find all the practicals exercises in the book ‚ÄúOn the R way to hell‚Äù with specific chapters to read and work on indicated in the schedule (for an overview see [here][r-chap-en]).
As part of the course you will have to submit lab reports (see Assessments for details).
I strongly suggest to read the practical material before coming, then used the first half of the practical to go through the exercises and take the second half to start working on the lab reports.
To write lab reports you can use quarto to produce nicely and easily formatted document in a reproducible manner. A template of a quarto document will be provided for each lab report.

title: Slides and course notes
text:
About slides  and notes 

Slides 
Slides in revealjs format (html). If you want then as a pdf (note you might loose some functionality or contents due to tabs and scroll sections):

Open the slides in your browser from a link on this page
Press e to get into the PDF export mode (?print-pdf should appear near the end of the url and white borders should appear)
Open the in-browser print dialog (CTRL/CMD+P).
Change the Destination setting to Save as PDF.
Change the Layout to Landscape.
Change the Margins to None.
Enable the Background graphics option (if you want it)
Click Save üéâ



Notes 
Content of the slides in html format as a self-contained downloadable file and including tabs and scroll sections.
More importantly, notes have the commenting and annotating tools activated via https://hypothes.is/. If you create a free account , you can annotate and comment slides as well as share your annotations/comments with the public or via private or public groups.

title: Bio4x58-5x58
text:
Lab assignments
The written reports count for 40% of the final grade. There are 8 reports and thus are 5% each. You can work individually or in teams up to three (latter is encouraged). If you submit a team assignment, except under exceptional circumstances all members of the team will receive the same grade. Assignments should be done using Quarto files (.qmd including R + markdown code) using the template provided and generate a html output. You must submit a single html copy of your assignments (generated from your .qmd document) with all students names and ID listed at the top (submit a single copy for the group). Late assignments will be penalized 10% per day or part thereof for a mximum of 3 days after which a grade of 0 will be given to that assignment. Assignments will consist of either a series of questions to answer or a statistical analysis to perform. Specific grading scheme is provided for each report on Brightspace

title: Bio4x58-5x58
text:
Exams

Midterm
1h30 long after the Reading week proctored during a practical. In class (see schedule for date), open book, calculators are permitted. A make-up will not be offered.  The midterm will be available on the course website afterwards; if you do not write it officially (e.g.¬†for medical reasons), then I strongly suggest you attempt it on your own time. We will happily mark it to provide feedback (your mark won‚Äôt count toward your final grade). Those who miss the midterm and do not do this generally perform poorly on the final.


Final exam (Bio4158 only)
This is an open book exam, with course notes and calculators permitted. The exam will be 3h and ask both theoretical and practical questions including some small calcul, No need to run any R code.

title: Bio4x58-5x58
text:
Extra report (Bio5158 only)
The final evaluation will take the form of a written report of the analysis of data (unique to each student) of 15 pages and to be submitted before the exam period.

title: Applied biostatistics with R  (Bio4158 / Bio5158)
text:
This is the site for the courses Bio4158/Bio5158 at the University of Ottawa. You will find all the course information including the course schedule, slides, course notes, practicals info and exercises, description of assessments as well as the (official) syllabus for the course.
Submission of course work is done via brighspace.

title: Julien Martin
text:
Julien is an Associate Professor at the University of Ottawa and has been teaching (and learning) R for the last 15 years.
I created the websites using Quarto, R, revealjs, mermaid.js and graphViz. I developed the theme for the slides based on the xaringan blackboard theme.

title: Syllabus
text:
Applied biostatistics to real problems. Experimental design and data collection. Consequences of violating assumptions of different tests. Monte Carlo and Bootstrap analysis. Case studies and exercises in using statistical analysis packages.
The course covers the fundations of statistics (distributions, CIs, p-values, central limit theorem, Bayesian thinking, ‚Ä¶) and linear models (t-test, ANOVA, regression, ANCOVA, general linear model) using R.

title: Diapositives et notes de cours
text:
√Ä propos des diapositives  et notes 

Diapositives 
Diapositives en revealjs format (html). Si vous les souhaitez en format pdf (Remarque : il se peut que vous perdiez certaines fonctionnalit√©s ou certains contenus en raison des onglets et des sections de d√©filement.) :

Ouvrez les diapositives dans votre navigateur √† partir d‚Äôun lien sur cette page
Appuyez sur e pour passer en mode d‚Äôexportation PDF (?print-pdf devrait appara√Ætre vers la fin de l‚Äôurl et des bordures blanches devraient appara√Ætre.)
Ouvrez la bo√Æte de dialogue d‚Äôimpression du navigateur (CTRL/CMD+P).
Modifiez l‚Äôoption Destination en Save as PDF.
Modifier le Layout √† Landscape.
Modifier le Margins √† None.
Activez l‚Äôoption Graphiques d‚Äôarri√®re-plan (si vous le souhaitez)
Cliquez sur Enregistrer üéâ



Notes 
Contenu des diapositives au format html sous la forme d‚Äôun fichier t√©l√©chargeable autonome et comprenant des onglets et des sections de d√©filement.
Plus important encore, les notes ont les outils de commentaire et d‚Äôannotation activ√©s via https://hypothes.is/. Si vous cr√©ez un compte gratuit, vous pouvez annoter et commenter des diapositives et partager vos annotations/commentaires avec le public ou via des groupes priv√©s ou publics.

title: Laboratoires
text:
Informations g√©n√©rales
Il y a 8 travaux pratiques pendant le trimestre. Les travaux pratiques se feront en √©quipes de 1 √† 3 pendant toute la dur√©e du semestre. Veuillez apporter votre ordinateur portable et assurez-vous d‚Äôavoir une version r√©cente de R (4.0.0 ou plus) ainsi qu‚Äôun IDE R tel que RStudio ou VSCode. Enfin, il est fortement recommand√© d‚Äôavoir le logiciel quarto pour produire des rapports reproductibles.
Vous trouverez tous les exercices pratiques dans le livre ‚ÄúSur le chemin de l‚Äôenf-R‚Äù avec des chapitres sp√©cifiques √† lire et √† travailler indiqu√©s dans le calendrier (pour une vue d‚Äôensemble voir [ici][r-chap-fr]).
